description: Dr. Mohammed Harara is one of five doctors remaining at Nasser hospital in Khan Younis. The collapsing medical facility, surrounded by the Israeli military, is home to 850 patients and thousands of displaced civilians. When Harara is not treating patients, he lives in a small tent on the hospital's grounds.
title: 27-year-old doctor cares for 850 patients in Gaza’s last standing hospital

description: Despite their rocky start, Argentina’s President Javier Milei and Pope Francis, who is from Argentina, appeared to have hit it off as they held their first meeting Monday.
title: Pope and Argentina's President Milei seem to hit it off despite rocky start

description: Israeli forces stormed a heavily guarded apartment in the Gaza Strip, rescuing two hostages. NBC News' Molly Hunter reports on the dramatic raid and the impact it has on the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Israeli forces storm Gaza Strip apartment, rescue two hostages

description: Biden will meet with Jordan's King Abdullah II at the White House as the administration continues talks on a possible hostage release deal in the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Biden and king of Jordan to meet amid hostage release talks in Israel-Hamas war

description: Trump's NATO Article 5 comments were condemned by America's allies across Europe as a gift to Putin.
title: Trump’s NATO jibe won’t be a surprise for Europe — but it could spell a reckoning

description: More than 1,500 protesters gathered in central Athens on Sunday to oppose legislation that would legalize same-sex marriage in Greece.
title: Hundreds of protesters opposed to bill allowing same-sex marriage rally in Greek capital

description: An Israeli military operation in Gaza’s southernmost city of Rafah would be “catastrophic” for the population there, more than half of whom have sought shelter in the governorate, the director of the United Nations agency for refugees told NBC News.
title: 'Where do you flee in a conflict?': U.N.'s Gaza chief on refugees' plight

description: Israel’s military hailed the rescue of two hostages overnight in Rafah, while local officials said the raid killed dozens of people in the crowded Gaza city.
title: Israeli forces rescue 2 hostages in a dramatic raid that kills dozens in Rafah

description: Children were among the injured taken to Rafah's Kuwait Hospital after an intense Israeli bombardment to help secure the rescue of two hostages.
title: Palestinian children among the wounded in Israel's bombardment of Rafah

description: A man was arrested Sunday on suspicion of killing five people, including three children who were pulled dead from a burning car in Canada, police said.
title: Man arrested in connection with 5 deaths, including 3 children pulled from burning car, in Canada

description: The European Union's High Representative Josep Borrell said "NATO cannot be an a la carte military alliance," after Donald Trump suggested the U.S. might not protect NATO allies who do not spend enough on their own defense.
title: 'Let's be serious': E.U.'s top diplomat responds to Trump's NATO remarks

description: Israel Defense Forces said it rescued two hostages — Fernando Simon Marman, 60, and Louis Har, 70 — from Rafah in an overnight mission and bombarded the city in order to help get the two men out of the Gaza Strip. NBC News' Claudio Lavanga reports for Early Today.
title: Israel rescues 2 hostages in Gaza as it bombards Rafah

description: President Joe Biden told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in a call on Sunday morning that the Rafah incursions shouldn’t go ahead without “a credible and executable plan” to ensure the safety of the more than 1 million people sheltering there. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports.
title: Biden tells Netanyahu Rafah incursions should not go ahead without plan to ensure civilians’ safety
